title: >>> BASISTA BOMBED?
body_text:
Lenny's absence brought in the famed
Rimshot Contest
for the second time in three weeks. Eight combatants looked to take down the mighty challenge that stood before them, the returning Sascha Basista.
Rimshot Contest #7
Participants: Kevin Adams, Mike Butler, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Matt Brown, Ray Marzarella, Terra Bergquist, Robert Brown, and Mike Edwards.
In one of the longest pre-game competitions ever, Ray Marzarella was the only competitor to smack the wooden rims and go on to the DODGEBALL 84 main event.
>> Sascha Basista vs. Ray Marzarella
On one side, one of the most fearless and reckless individuals ever in 17-year old Sascha Basista. On the other, the experienced and agile dodger,
Pond Scum
icon Ray Marzarella.
It was a long, grueling three-hour encounter which included just 4 complete games. One of the games took up so much time that the "Final 4", Fitzpatrick and Megill vs. Edwards and Tronolone, agreed to completely restart the game.
Those in attendance will likely remember DODGEBALL 84 as a strategic and methodical fight to the finish. Compared to other events, the elimination lines grew extreme slow, especially when teams were down to just a few participants.
Sascha Basista and Ray Marzarella fought to a 2 - 2 tie at DODGEBALL 84.
Moments & Stars
Steve Adams's incredible rolling-catch; Steve Adams immediately eliminated while celebrating his rolling-catch; Kevin Megill's ankle-catch; MaryJane McDowell suffering a bulletball to the eye after the lights had gone off.
The 84th Records
> Attendance: 24
> Biggest Returns:
Chris Daly (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LX3)
Steve Kass (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 66)
> New Players: (4) MaryJane McDowell, Jenny McDowell, Leeann McDowell, Kevin Wuchter
- The "Letsche Rims" returned for the first since DODGEBALL LXI as DODGEBALL 84 took place on the back courts of Wall High School.
- The original match planned for DODGEBALL 84 pitted Sascha Basista against Lenny Herrera. Lenny however was unable to make the event, forcing the 7th
Rimshot Contest
to occur.
- Sascha fought
Rimshot Contest
winner Ray Marzarella to a 2 to 2 draw. The last time a singles bout ended in a tie was at DODGEBALL LXI when Diana DiBuccio took on Kerrin Marchese. This was Ray's second consecutive event as captain.
-
Sascha Basista vs. Ray Marzarella
featured only 4 complete games despite the event concluding at 10:30.
- Along with Chris Daly and Steve Kass, the Brown Brothers, Rob and Matt, as well as Terra Bergquist returned to action after lengthy absences.
"I dominated. I rule ... John rules too. Greek Goddddddssss."
- TOM ADAMS
DODGEBALL 85:
4.28.07
... Celebrate a double birthday gathering for
Mike "Sputz" Krott
and
Lenny Herrera
! How will they run dodgeball?
DODGEBALL 86:
5.5.07
...
2005 vs. 2007
when the iconic
Kevin Adams
meets the up and coming
Grant Cornero
.
DODGEBALL 87:
5.12.07
... Off-court titans clash when
Liz Nogueira
takes on younger sis
Kathryn Nogueira
.
More great battles to come during Season 9!
*All matches Subject to Change*
body_html:
Lenny's absence brought in the famed Rimshot Contest for the second time in three weeks. Eight combatants looked to take down the mighty challenge that stood before them, the returning Sascha Basista.

Rimshot Contest #7
Participants: Kevin Adams, Mike Butler, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Matt Brown, Ray Marzarella, Terra Bergquist, Robert Brown, and Mike Edwards.

In one of the longest pre-game competitions ever, Ray Marzarella was the only competitor to smack the wooden rims and go on to the DODGEBALL 84 main event.

>> Sascha Basista vs. Ray Marzarella
On one side, one of the most fearless and reckless individuals ever in 17-year old Sascha Basista. On the other, the experienced and agile dodger, Pond Scum icon Ray Marzarella.

It was a long, grueling three-hour encounter which included just 4 complete games. One of the games took up so much time that the "Final 4", Fitzpatrick and Megill vs. Edwards and Tronolone, agreed to completely restart the game.

Those in attendance will likely remember DODGEBALL 84 as a strategic and methodical fight to the finish. Compared to other events, the elimination lines grew extreme slow, especially when teams were down to just a few participants.

Sascha Basista and Ray Marzarella fought to a 2 - 2 tie at DODGEBALL 84.

Moments & Stars Steve Adams's incredible rolling-catch; Steve Adams immediately eliminated while celebrating his rolling-catch; Kevin Megill's ankle-catch; MaryJane McDowell suffering a bulletball to the eye after the lights had gone off.

The 84th Records
> Attendance: 24
> Biggest Returns:
Chris Daly (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LX3)
Steve Kass (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 66)
> New Players: (4) MaryJane McDowell, Jenny McDowell, Leeann McDowell, Kevin Wuchter

- The "Letsche Rims" returned for the first since DODGEBALL LXI as DODGEBALL 84 took place on the back courts of Wall High School.
- The original match planned for DODGEBALL 84 pitted Sascha Basista against Lenny Herrera. Lenny however was unable to make the event, forcing the 7th Rimshot Contest to occur.
- Sascha fought Rimshot Contest winner Ray Marzarella to a 2 to 2 draw. The last time a singles bout ended in a tie was at DODGEBALL LXI when Diana DiBuccio took on Kerrin Marchese. This was Ray's second consecutive event as captain.
- Sascha Basista vs. Ray Marzarella featured only 4 complete games despite the event concluding at 10:30.
- Along with Chris Daly and Steve Kass, the Brown Brothers, Rob and Matt, as well as Terra Bergquist returned to action after lengthy absences.

"I dominated. I rule ... John rules too. Greek Goddddddssss."
- TOM ADAMS


DODGEBALL 85: 4.28.07 ... Celebrate a double birthday gathering for Mike "Sputz" Krott and Lenny Herrera! How will they run dodgeball?

DODGEBALL 86: 5.5.07 ... 2005 vs. 2007 when the iconic Kevin Adams meets the up and coming Grant Cornero.

DODGEBALL 87: 5.12.07 ... Off-court titans clash when Liz Nogueira takes on younger sis Kathryn Nogueira.

More great battles to come during Season 9!
*All matches Subject to Change*
